turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: Good Lord, Mr. Treves!

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: We've made tremendous strides today, Mothershead. He listens and repeats with great attention, and this certainly isn't easy for him.

turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: Parrots can do as much, Mr. Treves. It's all very nice, but I don't see the point. You know they won't let him stay here.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: I'm sure that if Mr. Merrick made a good impression on the hospital committee they'd see that he's the exception to their rule. Now I'm not expecting miracles. I'm not saying he'll be able to read or write, but I do think that I can get him to speak for himself. I'm going to arrange things with Carr Gomm right now.  That was very good, John, very good. That's all for today. We shall do some more tomorrow. Mothershead?

turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: Watery headed bunch.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: I regret that I must leave you here, m' Lord, m' Lady. Thank you so much for coming. It was an act of the greatest charity.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: Incredible, isn't it? Well, I think John has had enough visitors for one day, Mothershead. I've got a lecture at the college, I'll be back this evening.

turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: Excuse me, sir. I'd like to have a word with you.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: Oh?... Well, quickly please, Mothershead, I'm overdue.

turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: I can't understand why you let those people go in there, sir.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: Now Mothershead, you have to understand that this is very good for John. He relishes contact with people outside the hospital...

turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: But you saw them, sir. They couldn't hide their disgust. They don't care anything for John, they're just trying to impress their friends.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: Aren't you being just a little harsh, Mothershead? You yourself hardly treated John with much loving kindness when he first arrived.

turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: I bathed him, didn't I? I fed him and cleaned up after him! If loving kindness can be called care and practical concern, then yes, I did treat him with loving kindness, and I'm not ashamed to say it.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: You're right, Mothershead, please forgive me... Of course, I appreciate everything you've done for John, and I'm glad that you are concerned about his welfare. But, I'm the physician in charge and I must do what I think best. I'm also very late, so please forgive me.

turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: Mr. Treves, some more books arrived for Mr. Merrick.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: Thank you, Mothershead. Have a porter put them in my office.

turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: Yes sir.  What's that?

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: A dressing bag.

turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: Very smart indeed.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: Yes. John wants it.

turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: A dressing bag?

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: You don't think it's too gaudy, do you.

turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: John thinks it's very dashing. Something no gentleman should be without. I'm inclined to agree.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: So you see, John, there's no need for a lighthouse. All your friends are here.

turns.speaker: MOTHERSHEAD
turns.text: Welcome home, John.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: WHERE IS MR. MERRICK?

turns.speaker: NIGHT PORTER
turns.text: I... I don't know what you mean, Sir.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: Don't lie to me. I know all about it. You were SEEN. Where did you take him?

turns.speaker: NIGHT PORTER
turns.text: Take him? Now wait... I didn't take him anywhere. We were just having some fun. We didn't hurt him... just having a laugh, that's all.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: HE'S GONE!

turns.speaker: NIGHT PORTER
turns.text: When I left him, he was in his bed, safe and sound.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: YOU BASTARD! You tortured him. YOU TORTURED HIM, you bastard. WHERE is HE?

turns.speaker: NIGHT PORTER
turns.text: YOU'RE NOT LISTENING TO ME! I ain't done nothing wrong. People pay to see your monster, Mr. Treves. I just take the money.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: YOU'RE THE MONSTER! YOU'RE THE FREAK! GET OUT! YOU'RE FINISHED!

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: Are you the proprietor?

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: And who might you be, sir?

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: Just one of the curious. I'd like to see it.

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: I don't think so. No sir, we're closed.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: I'd pay handsomely for a private showing. Are you the proprietor?

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: Handsomely?... Who sent you?

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: Pardon me?

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: Never mind. I'm the owner.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: So you'll bring him to me, tomorrow, 10:00 a.m.? Mr...?

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: Bytes. Mr. Bytes. He'll be there.

turns.speaker: TREVES
turns.text: I'll send a cab. Here is my card.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Open up! I know you're in there!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Ah! It's my father!

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Open up! I know you're in there!

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Right! Where is he?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Who, Father?

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Who? Who? Whoever you've got in here of course!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: There IS no one.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Well... where is he?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: There's nobody here, Father. Look for yourself.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Ah! So you admit there IS someone!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: You're losing your temper!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: It's all in your own mind, Father... It's YOU who imagine that I'm always up here with some man or other....

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: I don't know how you do it, Aud... I sometimes think you've got some of your mother's magic...

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: There is no magic, Father... My mother had no magic...

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: She did, I tell you! She could blind me as easily as the night the day.

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: It's your fantasy...

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: But one day I'll catch you... Like I caught her...

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: It's all right! It isn't happening!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: But, Father, it IS!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: It's sinking! Hy-Brasil is sinking!

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Well, my dear, I think you'll find it's all a question of what you want to believe in.... I have slightly more experience of these matters than you...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: WHAT did you say?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: I said welcome.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: WELCOME?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Well, of course. We always welcome friends.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: How d'you KNOW we're "friends"?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Well, EVERYONE is friends here on Hy- Brasil.

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Please! Please! What are those?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: What are what?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Those things in your hands.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: These? What are THESE? They're swords.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: PLEASE! You don't know what you're doing!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Put them down!  PLEASE make them put them down.

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: WHY?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: But surely you know...?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Have you ever felt like this about anyone else?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: What... you mean "got into bed with" them?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: No, of course not, silly -- I mean FELT like this about them?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: You mean... you HAVE got into bed with somebody else?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: No, I mean have you ever felt that for the first time in your life you'd met somebody you could believe in with your whole heart... someone whose goals suddenly seem to be YOUR goals... whose dreams seem to be YOUR dreams?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: HAVE you ever been to bed with anyone else?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: What does that matter? But you've... you've... FELT like this before...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: It was different...

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: What was she like?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Oh... oh, I didn't know her very well...

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: But you LOVED her all the same...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: We never went to bed together.

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Why do you go on about that? What does it matter?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: You've been to bed with somebody else, haven't you?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: I've never LOVED anybody!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I've never been to bed with anybody!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: The Cloak Invisible. It was my mother's parting gift.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: "The fifth one this week"!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Oh, for goodness' sake!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: And I thought you said it was something special...

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: That's just what I was trying to tell you. You ARE...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Five this week; how many the week before?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: You're as bad as my father.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: And the week before that?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: We mustn't let him land!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Halfdan the Black.

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: But, Erik...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Just give me a hand.

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: I mean, you could have killed yourself.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Where's the Cloak Invisible?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I'll bring it back.

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Erik. You don't understand.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: No. It's YOU who doesn't understand, Aud. Halfdan has come to kill and destroy. We brought him here. We must stop him.

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: But you don't realize....

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Goodbye, Aud...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: And thanks for the Cloak Invisible!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: No! WAIT! ERIK! The Cloak! The Cloak Invisible! It only seems to work on my father!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: No! No! We are in the spell of the Horn! Hatred will destroy us.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: That's right!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: No. Don't look... The abyss will suck away your strength.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I MUST look! Keitel! Hold this!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: YOU still want to go to Asgaard?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Do you believe I love you?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I... but I...

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: You don't have to love me. Just: do you believe I love YOU?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Yes -- I believe you do.

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Then let go!

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: The second note.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: The second note to wake the Gods...

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Erik! You've done what you came to do!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Not quite...

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Blow the third note! The note to take us home!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: There is something I must ask the Gods...

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: No living man has ever set foot in the Halls of Asgaard... The Gods will never let you return.

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: Then I shall come too.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: No... no...

turns.speaker: AUD
turns.text: I don't want to live WITHOUT you.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: But, Aud... I... I came to find someone...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: LOKI! Where did YOU come from?

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: Halfdan wanted to stop you waking the Gods... so... I disguised myself to sabotage their plans.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: But --

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: It was my master Keitel's idea.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: But... How is it you can see me?  You can all see me?

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: What d'you mean?

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: How do we know this is the way?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: We blew the Horn Resounding.

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: SHE blew the Horn Resounding.

turns.speaker: FREYA
turns.text: Now what CAN you want with me, Erik the "Viking"?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I shouldn't have come.

turns.speaker: FREYA
turns.text: They will make fun of you for listening to an old woman's stories?

turns.speaker: FREYA
turns.text: What do you see, Erik?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I see the world.

turns.speaker: FREYA
turns.text: Is it night or day, Erik?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: It is day, of course, Freya.

turns.speaker: FREYA
turns.text: Is it summer or winter, Erik?

turns.speaker: FREYA
turns.text: Have you ever seen the sun, Erik?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: The sun is up beyond the clouds -- where it always is.

turns.speaker: FREYA
turns.text: But have you ever seen it? Think back...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Of course not... but... when I was a child... I remember a dream.... it was as if the whole sky was blue...

turns.speaker: FREYA
turns.text: The sky WAS blue, Erik... once.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Is there nothing men can do?

turns.speaker: FREYA
turns.text: The Gods are asleep, Erik.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I will go and wake them up!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: And will the dead ever return, Freya?

turns.speaker: FREYA
turns.text: That I cannot tell you.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: No... we don't...

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: The Gods decreed that if ever a sword spills human blood upon these shores, the whole of Hy-Brasil will sink beneath the waves.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Well... for a start... er... there's no killing...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Well, OBVIOUSLY there's no killing.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Well... isn't it great?

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Would you like us to sing to you?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: That's very kind of you, but we're in rather a hurry... We're...

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: What's the matter, don't you WANT to hear our singing?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Oh... well, yes, of course; it's just we're looking for the Horn Resounding and --

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: You don't think our singing's going to be good enough for you?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Oh, no no no! It's just the Horn Resounding is...

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: A lot of people like our singing.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I'm sure it's lovely.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: But you don't want to hear it.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: No... no...  We'd love to hear it. Wouldn't we?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Er... well... we... we... would be TERRIBLY grateful if you... all... would sing for us.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: You're just saying that.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Of course we're not; we'd genuinely like to hear you sing.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: REALLY?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: And you're not just saying it because you think we want you to?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Right! Summon the musicians! We'll do the one that goes "TUM-TUM-TUM- TUM-TI-TUM-TUM"

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: We're just not a very musical nation...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: No, no... It was very... er, nice.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Now I want you to be ABSOLUTELY, totally, genuinely honest with me. Did you really, truly, honestly like it?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: They didn't like it! Oh God! I want to die!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Your Majesty! We come from a world where there IS no music. Where men live and die by the axe and by the sword...

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Well, how d'you think I feel?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: The Gods are asleep, King Arnulf.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: YOU try to be nice to people, when they're rude about your singing...

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: I'll tell you what...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Careful!  They're not supposed to hurt you.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: You've got to let me go!

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: It's all part of our safety regulations. You see if someone were to get hurt they might get angry and then... well...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: They'll be more than "hurt" if Halfdan the Black lands! Ow!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: He's trying to stop us waking the Gods.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Because that's how he makes his money, by war and plunder!

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Don't talk nonsense.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: He wants to kill US!

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Not when we explain about the Great Blessing.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: You don't know Halfdan the Black.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: I know that the Great Blessing has kept the peace for a thousand years, and will keep it for the next thousand.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Is there something the matter with it?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Oh! No! No... of course not... it's just I hadn't expected it to be quite so big.

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Well, it's not called the Horn Resounding for nothing.  You DO know how to play the horn, don't you?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Yes... oh, yes...

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: Then I expect you'll be leaving first thing in the morning.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: But it IS! Look!

turns.speaker: KING ARNULF
turns.text: The important thing is not to panic.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: Have you done this sort of thing before?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Me? Of course! I've been looting and pillaging up and down the coast.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: Looting and pillaging, eh?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: What about the raping?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: It's obvious you haven't raped anyone in your life.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Sh!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Of course I like women... I LOVE 'em.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: You don't love ME.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: No... right... this is RAPE... Mark you, I'm not saying I couldn't get to like you... in fact... well, to be quite honest, I prefer it when there's some sort of mutual feeling between two people...

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: What -- rape?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: No. It isn't rape then, is it?

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: Oh, get it over with.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I don't suppose... no...

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I don't suppose you... you DO like me at all?

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: What d'you expect? You come in here, burn my village, kill my family and try to rape me...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I'll kill you if you say anything about this to anyone.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: About raping me?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: About NOT raping you...

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: You DON'T like it, do you?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Well it just seems a little bit crude, that's all.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: What about the killing and looting? That's just as crude, isn't it?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Oh well -- you've GOT to do them.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: Why? Why have you got to go round killing and looting?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: To pay for the next expedition, of course.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: But that's a circular argument! If the only reason for going on an expedition is the killing and looting and the only reason for the killing and looting is to pay for the next expedition, they cancel each other out.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Oh! Stop talking as if we were married!

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: Well you started it.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I just said I didn't feel like raping you.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: And I was just saying that rape is no MORE pointless or crude than all the killing and looting that goes on.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Scream.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Louder.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: Aaagh! Rape!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Oh, thanks.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: Thanks for saving me from a fate worse than death.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I didn't mean to!

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: Oh, that's all right then... it's the thought... that counts...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: You told them I raped you -- why?

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: I dunno... you looked so... so vulnerable...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Why should you care?

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: Why... should YOU care?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Tell me your name?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I've come to take you back to the land of the living.

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: What a stupid idea.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: What's the point of being dead in the land of the living?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I'll ask the Gods to give you life again!

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: Have you tried to ask the God for anything?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Well... no...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Is THAT Odin?

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: You'll have to wait till he's finished his game.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Odin!

turns.speaker: HELGA
turns.text: Why should you care?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I don't know! I just did!

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: FIND the Rainbow Bridge?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Find it... AND cross it!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: "But" what?

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: Nothing... Halfdan the Black chopped his hand off last night.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: He was lucky...  Sit there.

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Come on, move it!

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: It's Halfdan the Black!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I know. Snorri! Get your oar out!

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: Erik! Row! What are you doing?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: It saved my father!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: How deep IS the ocean?

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: Very deep... usually...

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: Let's hack her to pieces.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: What's wrong with making friends?

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: You don't go through all the hardships of an ocean voyage to make "friends".

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: That's terrible!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: You mean if just ONE PERSON gets killed?

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: Halfdan the Black's here!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I know!

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: He wants to KILL us.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: But. You're not even afraid of DEATH, Thorfinn!

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: I know. I know.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: It's not magic! It's just a trick!

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: Don't you FEEL it?

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: We're missing all the fun...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: What's it all about?

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: We toil and labor, we loot and pillage, rape and kill... and yet...

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: You talking piffle, son?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Where does it all get us, Grandpa?

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: Who have you been talking to?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I met this girl...

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: It's always the women that start the trouble.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: She got me thinking...

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: So? What'd you do to her?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I... I... KILLED her...

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: That's my boy!

turns.speaker: IVAR
turns.text: He can have my place. I don't want to go anyway.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Well, you ARE!

turns.speaker: IVAR
turns.text: I want to die...  No, I don't!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Row! Row! Row!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Slower! Nobody can row at that speed!

turns.speaker: IVAR
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Slower! In... Out...

turns.speaker: IVAR
turns.text: Sorry!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Faster!

turns.speaker: IVAR
turns.text: Make your mind up.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: What are YOU doing here?

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: You may need a real Berserk.

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: Ohh! I wanted to sit next to Leif.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Shut up. You there. You there and you there.

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: SHUT UP!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: ROW!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Look, the sky is blue...

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: The sun! That's it!

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: It's magic.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: What "magic"?

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: I've heard stories of a magic that strikes fear into the heart so you cannot fight.

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: What "magic" have you brought, Erik?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: You'll see!

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: What did he say?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Look out!
